column4: achlys- ill have to buy some more ram- the machine only has 248MB
achlys - ill set it to that npw
where will the vtx option be ?
This kernel requires the following features not present on the CPU :- pae << is the error msg when booting to the image thru virtualbox
error message is:- "This kernel requires the following features not present on the CPU :- pae"
have you installed the VB kernel modules?
did you recently update the linux kernel on your machine?  Virtualbox always needed to reload the kernel module after I did that
so your windows host is complaining about not having pae, or your Ubuntu guest OS?
weird.  Most computers have had pae support for decades, apparently
have you tried booting the Ubuntu CD directly, without virtualbox?
so you're just mounting the .iso in Windows?  You could try a USB stick
enabling pae might cause a problem with your Windows installation though... be warned
why do you even need pae on a guest OS?  Is your guest OS the 32-bit version of Ubuntu?  Are you certain it's not Ubuntu Server?
you can maybe try the minimal iso version as per: http://www.webupd8.org/2012/05/how-to-install-ubuntu-1204-on-non-pae.html
